titleproper.value:
Preliminary Inventory to the George Brodsky: Yiddish Clippings and Serials
          Collection <num>ALBA.181</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace
        <date>2017-09-08T14:30:53</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: George Brodsky: Yiddish Clippings and Serials Collection

p.value:
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
        Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment,
        tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

The collection consists of clippings and photocopies of clippings pertaining to the Spanish
        Civil War and especially to Jewish participation in the War. Among them are many cartoons,
        photos, and other graphics clipped from a variety of Yiddish-language newspapers and
        journals, most of them published in the United States. Much of the material dates from the
        Spanish Civil War era; other items are commemorative or historical in nature. There is a
        large folder of clippings of cartoons on the Civil War and the fight against fascism by
        William Gropper (from the <emph render="italic">Morgen Freiheit</emph>), a folder of
        cartoons by (from <emph render="italic">Der Tog</emph>), and a number of cartoons from other
        sources. Many of the clippings are pasted on pages from a notebook or scrapbook, apparently
        compiled ca. 1936-1938. The bulk of the individual clippings are unidentified as to source,
        and undated, but the pages could be reassembled in chronological order by comparing the
        clippings to the original newspapers that are the main sources for them. Also included are
        several complete issues and articles from <emph render="italic">Folks-Sztyme</emph>
        (1966-1976), a Yiddish newspaper published in Warsaw.
